data.text:
In the 1920’s, one of the biggest studios in Hollywood was Metro-Goldwyn Mayer. Or as you may know it as, “MGM”, or “the company with the lion at the beginning of movies.” This studio was founded in 1924 and their first film was released in 1925. They have released many popular films that most people have either seen or heard of as well as some not-so popular films that most people didn’t even knew existed. Some you may recognize is Poltergeist, The Hobbit, and even The Wizard of Oz. Today, Metro-Goldwyn Mayer is still one if the biggest and most influential studios in Hollywood. However, the success, figuring everything out, and how the studio became, didn’t happen overnight. Marcus Leow, the founder of Metro-Goldwyn Mayer, wasn’t always successful in life. His family was poor and he grew up having t work instead of get a proper education. As Leow grew older, he saved his money to buy studios. Marcus Leow first bought Metro Pictures, which was then where his studio started to grow bigger and set off. Metro-Goldwyn Mayer started out just making and producing smaller films. Then, Marcus Leow decided he wanted to expand to bigger productions. By expanding, Metro combined with …show more content…

After Leow, the founder and owner of MGM, died, William Fox bought out Metro-Goldwyn Mayer. However, Lois Mayer wasn’t happy about that and used political connections saying that what Fox was doing violated some laws and had the motion blocked. Fox then got in a car accident and he was severely injured causing all of his business deals to be held up and on pause until he was recovered. When William Fox finally did recover, the stock market crash of 1929 caused him to lose his money which meant he wasn’t able to buy out Metro-Goldwyn Mayer anymore, calling the whole thing off which allowed Metro-Goldwyn Mayer to stay the company they are
